reviews.title: A deserved break
reviews.text: I wanted a get away before school started again from Christmas break and have a couple of friends in Palm Springs CA, so I thought why not.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I got on the computer and ended up booking with Hotels.com and got a great package for RT Air, lodging and car for the weekend.
reviews.title: Really nice and great restaurant nearby with 10% off

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was the Quality Inn Palm Springs and what caught my eye was their add went out of the way to let Gay travelers know they were welcomed.
reviews.title: Good Value for Money

likes.liked: — A no-nonsense hotel. Basic but efficient.
likes.disliked: — No 4-star hotel with all the associated disadvantages. However, good for what it is.

reviews.title: pretty good
reviews.text: The hotel was well located, clean and quiet. The staff was friendly, courteous and helpful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I choose this hotel over the one recommended by the convention we attend (The Palm Springs Spectacular) in spite of a higher rate due to the cleanliness of the facility, the helpfulness of the staff and the amenities of a restaurant really close. We are booked again for this Februar, 2008.
reviews.title: Fine for the money

likes.disliked: — Palm Springs was too hot this time of year

reviews.text: Stayed there this weekend (4/2/05) for the first and last time. We arrive at six pm to find that the reservation service supposedly booked us into a Smoking room, and that they were "completely booked up, and couldn't change us! Yet the parking lot NEVER filled up all night. The male desk clerk was exceptionally rude and confrontational. Interesting that someone else had a similar experience with a desk clerk here on TripAdvisor!
reviews.title: Not a great choice

reviews.text: As it was late enough, we decided against trying to locate another room in town, and checked into what we discovered was a small room with king bed. The cigarette burn on the bed cover was almost "stylish.". Maybe they have rooms that look like their photo, but this one certainly didn't . The shower head was very low at 5 foot high, but the pressure was decent and the room appeared clean. Parking was plentiful, and close to the rooms in that clasic two -story motor inn style. Exterior entry doors, under-window individual air-conditioning units, nice pool area. If you get it a a low enough price, it would be okay for a night.
reviews.title: Not a bad choise
not as bad as I thought~
reviews.text: This Quality Inn certainly needs some remodelling. Too many other choices in Palm Springs. With the small room, and rude host, I will not be back.

reviews.title: Why all the complaints?
reviews.text: This is very late but: We stayed there for a week in May 2004. While the fellow at the front desk was a bit rude the rest of the staff was nice. This is an older hotel but relatively well maintained, nice pool, lots of lounge chairs and towels, well maintained lawns and shrubs. The rooms were OK and clean. I can't understand some of the complaints.

Above average for what I was expecting.....Went here with the whole family for a get-away. I was very apprehensive but I wasn't paying for the hotel so I didn't have a choice. It actually wasn't so bad. We had 6 rooms all together and the 3 on the top floor were "non-smoking" but stunk badly of smoke. The downstairs rooms were clean and not smelly. The king rooms were small. We couldn't get any rooms with double beds. I don't know if that is because there weren't any or because we made our reservations late..but the roll away barely fit.
reviews.title: Why the terrible reveiws??
Waste of Money
reviews.text: I regret very much staying here. Yes it was a good price but had I known it was going to look like a run down hole in the wall I would have stayed somewhere else. It has a bad odor both outside and in. The pool is small so even if there are few people inside it looks crowded. They do have a fitness room if that's what you would like to call one bike, a treadmill and a weight bench that didn't work.

Low-priced but with a less-than-stellar location about five miles from the main drag, this motel is more of a last option than a destination. Priced about $60-75/night less than the lower-end resorts in town, the Quality Inn Palm Springs offers little to make the savings worth it. The rooms are small and in my limited experience, not so clean, with stains on the bedcover and ground in dirt in the shower. The pool was nice but not one chaise lounge was available at 9 a.m. on a holiday weekend -- and at these prices, there were lots of families and lots of screaming kids.
reviews.title: Small rooms/not so clean
Customers are always wrong.
reviews.text: After reading the reviews on several webpages, I noticed that all of them said that the hotel was relatively nice but the staff was more than incompetent, figuring that I wouldnt have to deal with the staff much, I proceeded to book a room.

reviews.title: Dirty beds
reviews.text: I would have gladly slept on the cement outside, in the scorching sun.

reviews.title: hotel treats internet reservation customers poorly
reviews.text: This company has no regard for its customers just like others have posted, but this time DO NOT pass up my comments. Stay at any other hotel, if possible as they will not be accomdating to any common needs.... blankets and pillows? nope sorry, were out. (noticed pillows in the back) ... but I ordered a double bed...("sorry we are all sold out of the double bed rooms, you will have to deal with a king size bed.") ... Could I be put on a waiting list, should one of those double bed rooms becomes available, I can get one? ("SURE.")

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sometimes I'll read reviews on Trip Advisor and wonder if I was staying at the same hotel. People need to realize that if you're paying $89/night, you aren't going to have a Ritz Carlton experience.
reviews.title: Good value for the money
Crappy Hotel
reviews.text: This hotel was what I expected from a Quality Inn. The staff was OK (I only had minimal interaction with them), and the room was what I would expect from a mid-range hotel. The orange scented toiletries were great. We had a fridge in our room, which is great to have in the heat of Palm Springs. There's a Carrow's restaurant in the parking lot which is very convenient, and a shopping center down the street if you need groceries. My chief complaint is that the carpets were dirty. I like to lounge around in white socks and they ended up rather dirty.

A couple of days later I called because I thought I had left something behind in my room. Even though he could have just blown me off, the person I talked to was friendly and checked the lost and found (my stuff wasn't there, but I didn't really expect it to be).
reviews.title: Basic motel with a few perks for the price
A good place !
reviews.text: This is one of the worst places I have stayed in quite a while. The "fitness room" which is 5" X 4" only had one working piece of equipment (the treadmill - the other "3" were out of service). The "spa" was kept at a lukewarm 98 degrees. When I asked for another blanket I was told they didn't have anymore. The maid had an envelope asking for a tip but on the second day (and thereafter) they did not replenish coffee, sugar, cups, or anything else!!! You were asked to use the towels in the pool area for the pool but guess what? - there weren't any...... The front desk people were surly and rude. Now, of course, given the price I didn't expect a very nice room (and it wasn't) but at least it could have been half-way clean. I have stayed at smaller hotels in Palm Springs at half the price and DOUBLE the charm. Needless to say, this was a mistake that we will never do again!!!!!

reviews.title: Just Great
reviews.text: Most people who come to Palm Springs want a memorable vacation. If you are one of those people, I would suggest you stay at a more central hotel. The Quality Inn is fine for: 1) people on a strict budget 2) people driving through enroute to another location or 3) people with kids.
